content: Please remember that it is not Thunderbird refusing your password, it is your email provider, using Thunderbird to deliver the message. The real error may be that the account is improperly configured. If you want assistance, you will need to post screenshots of your incoming and outgoing server settings panes, plus the complete error page. Thanks.
creator: davidsk

content: Devi chiedere al tuo fornitore, solo lui sa a cosa corrisponde l'errore "policy violation" Normalmente significa che non stai rispettando le condizioni di fornitura. Thunderbird comunque ti sta solo mostrando il messaggio che riceve dal server.
creator: @next

content:
Se in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi funziona, allora:

  1. se hai delle estensioni disattivale tutte e fino a trovare quella responsabile del problema
  2. se questo non risolve, disattiva l'accelerazione hardware -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/impostazioni-thunderbird-pannello-avanzate#w_impostazioni-avanzate

Per prudenza fai prima un backup -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
creator: @next

content: There is no donation requirement. You may donate at an amount which represents the value you are getting from Thunderbird on these devices.

content:
Forse è stato attivato il nuovo Centro account Lo puoi disattivare da

Menu > Impostazioni > Generale Sezione Centro account Togli la spunta da Crea account nel nuovo Centro account

A questo punto puoi usare la vecchia procedura automatica -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-automatica-account

o la procedura manuale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/configurazione-manuale-account

creator: mail2456

content: I suppose you did receive email server settings from your hosting provider? Then you should probably check with your hosting provider about a password reset. Did you tell Thunderbird to remember the password by any chance? Then you may be able to recover it from the Thunderbird 'Saved Passwords' underneath Settings. However, if that was the case then you shouldn't have got a password prompt in the first place.
creator: christ1

content:
If the recent messages are still on the server, then you can get them through web mail.

To get them through Thunderbird, you will, of course, need the right password and other settings. Would you please post the screenshot of the error message and say who your e-mail service provider is? Then someone here will be able to help more.

Did you re-set your password with your e-mail service provider and then enter the new password into Thunderbird?

Do you have a back-up copy of your files from the crashed computer?
creator: mozilla98

content: You have not described your problem. You want to sort folders alphabetically but you cannot? Thunderbird does sort folders alphabetically. Would you please post a screenshot so people can see what might be causing different behavior?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Yes, I want to sort alphabetically - the default since 2003. I can't post a picture because it's clients names and companies but an example is:

01 Tiger Amy B Ann K Piper press Steven B Shawn A University of You 2023 invoices Axis B Boris K Costas L Dorr Press Pyre Sage Press See Press

So it doesn't make any sense. Parts are alphabetical but then it just skips to some other random order. Interesting, all the sub folders of these folders are in alphabetical order. But the main first tier folders are unusable.

There's at least one other thread regarding this. I signed up for alerts for it but I don't have the URL :(
creator: bk913

content:
Did you sort folders manually? To return to alphabetical sorting, right click on the account name and select "Reset folder order".

Did that work?
creator: mozilla98

content: click settings>composition and turn it off. If you are also seeing grammar suggestions, those may be coming from an addon or other software running on your computer.
creator: davidsk

content: Exactly where do I turn it off??
creator: BSM1

content: puzzling. click 'new message' and click options from menu bar and see if it is ticked there. if menu bar isn't visible, click the alt key. If it's turned off there too, my suspicion is that another product is doing this. Some grammar products that work with browser also involve themselves with email. And do check your addons.
creator: davidsk

content:
1 Write new message 2 Options>Check spelling - pop-up asking for word to be input to check 

   Options>Spell Check As You Type - tickable for On or Off. Always Off

3 Writing this message - Spellcheck is working here as well!! "new" and "message" underlined
creator: BSM1

content: Found it. GRAMMARLY!! I have no idea when it installed itself on my PC. It is no longer.

content: I do not understand your question, but when you're in the compose window, you can click F9 to have a list of email addresses listed to the left of the composition window.

content: To my knowledge, the clipboard is for text to be copied and pasted, not documents. If what you have is a pdf file, use the attach feature.
creator: davidsk

content:
Try to start Windows 10 in safe mode with networking enabled.

Does the problem go away?

Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software. This is a troubleshooting step, not a solution.
creator: christ1

content: try rightclicking the account in folder pane and click 'subscribe' to see if there is a tickbox by the new folder. if folder was just created, you may need to close and reopen thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: Verizon and AOL require an APP password when using email clients on a PC. I believe you must go to the AOL site and select the security page and can set up the APP password there. See this page for more info: https://help.aol.com/articles/Create-and-manage-app-password
creator: davidsk
